page.title: 20Population
page.content: In the year 1068 there was a manor in ALSAGER but no recorded population.The {Domesday Book}entry reveals "The Earl himself hold Eleacier, Uluric a tree man held it. There is a half hide rateable to the gelt. The land is one carucate. It is waste". By the{twelfth {century}Alsager was a township in Barthomley Parish. In{1801}there were 49 houses and 275 people and by 1810 there were 349 people. Between 1801 and 1831 land enclosure attracting newcomers doubled the population. The arrival of the railway turned Alsager from a country hamlet into a dormitory town for 'The Potteries'. One hundred years later in{1948}the population was 4000 due mainly to the establishment of the Royal Ordnance Factory. In {1970} the population was 10,580 in {1985 }it is approximately 12,000 and residential development continues.
